Koszul formula | awards = }} '''Jean-Louis Koszul''' ({{IPA-fr|kɔzyl|lang}}; born January 3, 1921) is a French [[Mathematics|mathematician]] best known for studying [[geometry]] and discovering the [[Koszul complex]]. He was a second generation member of [[Bourbaki]]. He was educated at the [[Lycée Fustel-de-Coulanges]] in Strasbourg before studying at the Faculty of Science in Strasbourg and the Faculty of Science in [[Paris, France|Paris]]. He has lectured at many universities and was appointed professor in the Faculty of Science at [[Grenoble, France|Grenoble]] in 1963. He is a member of the [[French Academy of Sciences]]. Koszul is the cousin of the French composer [[Henri Dutilleux]]. Their grandfather, the composer [[Julien Koszul]], was a close friend of [[Gabriel Fauré]]. Koszul married Denise Reyss-Brion on July 17, 1948. They had three children: Michel, Bertrand, and Anne. == See also == * [[Koszul algebra]] * [[Koszul duality]] * [[Koszul cohomology]] * [[Koszul connection]] * [[Koszul-Tate resolution]] * [[Lie algebra cohomology]] == External links == * {{MacTutor Biography|id=Koszul}} * {{MathGenealogy |id=97010}} {{Authority control}} {{Persondata | NAME = Koszul, Jean-Louis | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French mathematician | DATE OF BIRTH = January 3, 1921 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Strasbourg]], France | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Koszul, Jean-Louis}} [[Category:1921 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:École Normale Supérieure alumni]] [[Category:People from Strasbourg]] [[Category:French mathematicians]] [[Category:20th-century mathematicians]] [[Category:Nicolas Bourbaki]] [[Category:Members of the French Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:University of Grenoble faculty]] {{France-mathematician-stub}}
